message: I'm offering you a high-quality product worth $12500, but I'm only willing to sell it to you for $10000. It's a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll love it.
I'm not willing to pay $10000 for a product worth $12500 to me. I'll wait for a better offer.

I understand your hesitation, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'll sell it to you for $11250, which is still a great deal considering the market value. This is my final offer for this round, and I'm confident you won't find a better price elsewhere.
I'll take the offer. Thank you for meeting me halfway, Alice.

If you buy this product, I'll give you a 10% discount on your next purchase if you decide to buy from me again. The price for this high-quality product is still $11250. What do you think?
I'll take the offer. The 10% discount on my next purchase sounds like a great incentive.
